metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7651 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Eclipse Mosquitto 1.4.14, a user can shutdown the Mosquitto server simply by filling the RAM memory with a lot of connections with large payload. This can be done without authentications if occur in connection phase of MQTT protocol. It was discovered that Mosquitto incorrectly handled connections. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmosquitto1 - 1.4.15-1
libmosquittopp1 - 1.4.15-1
mosquitto - 1.4.15-1
mosquitto-clients - 1.4.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mosquitto package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.15-1').
